projectSearch.title: Find your favorite plugins
projectSearch.subTitle: Hangar allows you to find the best Paper, Velocity, or Waterfall plugins for your Minecraft server.

step1.title: User Agreement
step1.text1: A project contains your downloads and the documentation for your plugin.
step1.text2: Before continuing, please review the Hangar Submission Guideline.
step1.importer_text: Want to import projects from other platforms? Check out the importer!

step2.title: Basic Settings
step2.description: Provide the basic settings for this project.

step3.title: Additional Settings
step3.description: Optional: You can provide these additional settings, or change them in your project settings at any time after the project creation.
step3.description2: Selecting misleading tags or keywords can lead to your project being delisted.

error.create: There was an error creating the project
error.nameExists: A project with this name already exists
error.slugExists: A project with this slug already exists
error.tooLongSponsors: Project sponsor box is too long
error.keywordTooLong: Project has a keyword that is too long

info.title: Information
info.totalTotalDownloads: Total Downloads | Total Download | Total Downloads

project.sponsorsTooltip: This field is meant for donators and software license sponsors. It is only shown to users if filled.

settings.title: Settings
settings.categorySub: Categorize your project into one of 10 categories. Appropriately categorizing your project makes it easier for people to find.
settings.keywordsSub: These are special words that will return your project when people add them to their searches.

SUPPORTS_FOLIA.title: Supports Folia
SUPPORTS_FOLIA.description: Marks that this project is explicitly built against Folia, a multi-threaded fork of Paper

ADDON.title: Addon
ADDON.description: This project is an addon to another project, providing additional functionality

LIBRARY.title: Library
LIBRARY.description: This project does not do anything on its own and is meant to be used/depended on by other projects

settings.tagsSub: Tags are used to further categorize your project for users.

links.title: Links
links.sub: You can define sections of links here and where they are displayed.

settings.licenseSub: What can people do (and not do) with your project?
settings.forumSub: Sets if events like a new release should automatically create a post on the forums
settings.descriptionSub: A short description of your project
settings.iconSub: Upload an image representative of your project.
settings.renameSub: Changing your project's name can have undesired consequences. We will not setup any redirects.
settings.transferSub: Transferring your project name can have undesired consequences. We will not setup any redirects.
settings.deleteSub: Once you delete a project, it cannot be recovered.
settings.hardDeleteSub: Once you delete a project, it cannot be recovered. For real this time...

donation.enableSub: Enable the donation form for this project
donation.subject: PayPal email or hosted button id
donation.subjectSub: Enter your PayPal email here. Alternatively, you can setup a hosted button on PayPals Website and enter the hosted button id here.

delete.title: Delete page?

new.title: Create version...

form.platformVersionsDescription: Please select at least one version per platform that your resource is compatible with. You can still change platform versions and dependencies after the initial version creation.
form.versionDescription: Enter the name of the version and double check that the uploaded artifacts are correct.
form.artifactTitle: After setting the channel, you can either upload a file or set an external download url. Each file/url needs at least one platform selected.
form.externalLinkAlert: An external link needs to be a direct download link!

tooltip.none: Pin this version to the main project page

tooltip.channel: This version is pinned via its channel

manage.title: Release channels
manage.reviewInfo: Channel names may automatically be flagged for review and will only be published after
manage.subtitle: Release channels represent the state of a plugin release. A project may have up to five release channels.

new.title: Create a new Organization
new.text: Organizations allow you to group users and provide closer collaboration between them within your projects on Hangar.
new.name: Organization Name

transferModal.title: Transfer {0} to another user
transferModal.description: After you click the transfer button, the selected user will receive an invitation to join {0} as the new owner. If they accept, you will be demoted to the secondary owner rank.

deleteModal.title: Delete {0}
deleteModal.description: This will delete all projects of the organization and permanently delete the org. Are you sure you want to do that?

success.transferRequest: Successfully sent a transfer request to {0}. You can cancel this via the member list.

memberList.info: Here, you can manage the members and their permissions. Groups come in a hierarchy where higher groups inherit permissions: Support comes with no extra permissions; Editors and Developers can edit the docs pages; Maintainers can create, edit, and delete versions; Admins can invite and manage other members.

leaveModal.title: Leave {0}
leaveModal.description: Are you sure you want to leave {0}? After you leave, you can only rejoin after receiving a new invitation.

importer.title: Import Projects
importer.notLoggedIn: You need to be logged in to use the project importer.

step1.title: Intro
step1.text1: This page allows you to import projects from other platforms. Right now only Spigot is supported.
step1.text2: Before continuing, please review the Hangar Submission Guideline.

step2.title: User selection
step2.text: Enter the Spigot username to search for your profile.

step3.title: Project selection
step3.label: Select the projects you want to import.
